key_repos.name: engine
key_repos.description: JavaScript library to interact with RAILGUN smart contracts

key_repos.name: wallet
key_repos.description: SDK for dApp/DeFi developers to enable privacy features

key_repos.name: private-proof-of-innocence
key_repos.description: PPOI Node and Dashboard for bad transaction prevention

notable_results.trustblock_transparency: All audits publicly accessible via Trustblock

audits.ongoing_security: Continuous audit relationships with multiple firms

broadcaster_network.description: Decentralized network of relayers that submit transactions on behalf of users
trust_properties: No custody of funds - broadcasters never hold user assets
Cannot decrypt or modify transaction details
Economic disincentives for misbehavior (gas costs without fee completion)
Permissionless participation - anyone can run a broadcaster
broadcaster_network.fee_structure: Default 10% premium to gas fees, user-selectable broadcasters
broadcaster_network.game_theory: Only requires 1 cooperative broadcaster for transaction success

trusted_setup.type: Perpetual Powers of Tau MPC ceremony
trusted_setup.security_model: Secure if at least 1 participant is honest
trusted_setup.industry_standard: Same approach used by Zcash, Filecoin, Ethereum Semaphore

smart_contract_verification.snark_proof_verification: Contracts verify zk-SNARK proofs without signature
smart_contract_verification.on_chain_verifiers: EIP-197 and EIP-198 enable on-chain circuit verification

known_exploits_vulnerabilities.protocol_exploits: None known - RAILGUN smart contracts have not been directly exploited

related_incidents.railgun_involvement: Hacker attempted to use RAILGUN to launder funds
related_incidents.outcome: RAILGUN's automated PPOI system blocked the deposit, funds returned to original wallet

related_incidents.railgun_involvement: Hacker successfully used RAILGUN to mix some funds
related_incidents.outcome: PPOI list was outdated due to rapid address hopping by hacker

related_incidents.railgun_involvement: Lazarus Group laundered ~$60M ETH through RAILGUN in January 2023
related_incidents.outcome: Portion of funds frozen in coordination with exchanges; led to PPOI development

known_exploits_vulnerabilities.security_response: PPOI system developed to prevent illicit fund mixing

comparison_to_tornado_cash.railgun_status: Never sanctioned despite Lazarus Group usage

regulatory_differentiation.proactive_compliance: PPOI system using Chainalysis OFAC list by default
regulatory_differentiation.treasury_recognition: Under Secretary Brian Nelson acknowledged difference between 'obfuscation' and 'privacy-enhancing services'
regulatory_differentiation.co_founder_cooperation: RAILGUN co-founder has communicated with federal authorities

factors: Historical use by Lazarus Group for money laundering
PPOI system can be bypassed with rapid address changes
Regulatory environment for privacy protocols remains uncertain
No explicit regulatory approval or safe harbor
mitigating_factors: Vitalik Buterin public endorsement and usage

ofac_sanctions_status.source: FBI press releases, Treasury statements, court rulings, news reports

cryptographic_foundation.primary_technology: zk-SNARKs (Zero-Knowledge Succinct Non-Interactive Arguments of Knowledge)
cryptographic_foundation.elliptic_curve: ECC (Elliptic Curve Cryptography) for smaller keys and succinct proofs
cryptographic_foundation.circuit_purpose: Different input/output combinations for gas optimization

private_defi_capabilities: Shield ERC-20 tokens into private addresses

process: 1. Create: User generates non-custodial RAILGUN wallet with private 0zk address
2. Shield: Tokens deposited into 0zk address, entering encrypted state
3. Transact: All balances and transactions become encrypted
4. Use: Transfer between 0zk addresses or interact with DeFi privately
shielded_transfer_mechanism.utxo_model: Uses UTXOs (Unspent Transaction Outputs) similar to Bitcoin/Zcash
shielded_transfer_mechanism.proof_generation: Client-side zk-SNARK proof generation, on-chain verification

how_it_works: Monitors tokens entering RAILGUN smart contract
Verifies tokens are not from known illicit sources
Generates ZK proof of non-inclusion in blocklist
Proofs carry forward through all subsequent transactions
private_proofs_of_innocence.standby_period: 1 hour before shielded tokens can be used (allows list updates)
private_proofs_of_innocence.accumulator_system: Merkle tree accumulator for blinded proof verification
private_proofs_of_innocence.privacy_preservation: No data shared with list providers; only yes/no inclusion check
private_proofs_of_innocence.user_flexibility: Users can select jurisdiction-specific lists (EU, US, etc.)

viewing_keys.description: Shareable read-only keys for transaction history

governance.staking: DAO staking and governance (also audited by Zokyo)

vitalik_buterin.usage: Transferred 662 ETH (~$1.91M) to RAILGUN over 10 months
vitalik_buterin.public_statements: Emphasized importance of RAILGUN's privacy pools

differences: RAILGUN: Full DeFi privacy vs Tornado Cash: Simple mixing
RAILGUN: PPOI compliance system vs Tornado Cash: No compliance features
RAILGUN: Never sanctioned vs Tornado Cash: OFAC sanctioned (later reversed)
RAILGUN: On-chain privacy pools vs Tornado Cash: Fixed denomination pools

vs_aztec.aztec: Layer 2 rollup approach, more centralized during development

items_requiring_verification: Complete list of all audit findings (critical/high severity issues)
Detailed PPOI blocklist update frequency and coverage
Exact number of trusted setup ceremony participants
areas_for_deeper_research: Long-term regulatory trajectory given evolving sanctions landscape
PPOI effectiveness against sophisticated laundering techniques
